meanings.definition: To leave one's own country in order to settle permanently in another.
meanings.sent1: Many families emigrated from Europe to America for a better life.
meanings.sent2: My grandparents emigrated from Italy to the United States many years ago.
meanings.sent3: The ducks emigrated to the other side of the pond for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: The seeds emigrated from the flower to find new places to grow.
meanings.sent5: The students emigrated to the library to study for their exams.

meanings.definition: To depart from one country or region to settle in another.
meanings.sent1: The birds emigrated south for the winter to find warmer weather.
meanings.sent2: Many people emigrated from the rural areas to the city in search of work.
meanings.sent3: The ants emigrated from the kitchen to the garden, looking for food.
meanings.sent4: The fish emigrated upstream to spawn in the fresh water.
meanings.sent5: The nomadic tribe emigrated across the desert in search of a new home.
